item.title: Marvel Rivals Showcases Rogue‚Äôs Vanguard Moves In New Trailer
item.content:encoded:
Rogue is the next character set to arrive in Marvel Rivals on December 12 with Season 5.5, and the developers have provided the usual glimpse of her vanguard moves in a new trailer.

Anna Marie, or more commonly known as Rogue, is perhaps one of the most beloved members of the X-Men in the Marvel fandom. Partnered with her beloved Gambit, fans have been wanting to see her inclusion for a long time, and to see her as a vanguard is just the cherry on top.

Rogue Heading To Marvel Rivals

At first glance, Rogue looks poised to shake up the meta in a completely unique way. She‚Äôs built primarily as a close-quarters brawler, diving into the thick of the fight and dealing impressive damage up close. But she‚Äôs far from limited to melee‚Äîshe can yank enemies toward her and chip away at anyone caught within her damaging aura.

The real show-stealer, though, is her ability to borrow powers from other heroes. Whoever she drains, she can temporarily wield their abilities as if they were her own. The trailer highlights just how versatile this can be: Psylocke‚Äôs invisibility, Thor‚Äôs lightning strikes‚Äîit all becomes part of Rogue‚Äôs toolkit, giving her the potential to dominate the battlefield like no other Vanguard.

Her Ultimate amplifies things even further, letting her batter nearby foes while shielding herself and unleashing heavy, punishing blows. A new Vanguard is always an exciting addition to Marvel Rivals, but Rogue looks ready to steal the spotlight in every sense.

It‚Äôs always been the season of Rogue and Gambit, and the notorious couple are finally paired together in-game. What do you think of Rogue‚Äôs vanguard abilities in Marvel Rivals? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Marvel Rivals content, check out the game‚Äôs new gacha system, as well as how you can now buy and gift in-game items directly from Discord.

item.title: Cyberpunk TCG Announced by CDPR and WierdCo
item.content:encoded:
Cyberpunk Trading Card Game (TCG) has been officially announced, featuring characters from Cyberpunk 2077 and Edgerunners.

CD Projekt Red has been hard at work developing the sequel to Cyberpunk 2077, even revealing its plans to expand the game‚Äôs development foundation by 2027. However, nobody knew they were working on a physical-only trading card game for the franchise, with an announcement popping up out of nowhere.

Cyberpunk TCG is for Collectors, Traders, and Fans of the Franchise

In Cyberpunk TCG, players will be tasked with putting together their ultimate edgerunner team by collecting characters from the franchise and putting them up against their friends. Players will receive ‚Äústunning custom artwork‚Äù with characters from both the base game, Cyberpunk 2077, and the anime adaptation, Edgerunners. The official announcement on X (formerly Twitter) also arrived with a new trailer, showcasing the type of cards players should expect.

The trailer reveals all the cards players will collect in Cyberpunk TCG, grouping them into categories. The first are Units, which include names like Psycho Squad, Offduty Malfini, and Swordwise Huscle. Then we come to all the Chrome cards players will be able to collect, with Mantis Blades, Kiroshi Optics, and Mandibular Upgrade highlighted. Next, we have characters, which are some of the most iconic personalities from the game, with Panam Palmer, Jackie Welles, Judy Alvares, Goro Takemura, V, and Adam Smasher cards revealed.

Cyberpunk TCG is coming to Kickstarter in 2026 by CD Projekt Red and WierdCo. Interested players can sign up on their website right now for a free, exclusive Lucy card.

In other news, Cyberpunk 2077 recently hit a new sales milestone. Additionally, the sequel could feature online multiplayer. What are your thoughts on Cyberpunk TCG getting an official announcement? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim releasing again in 2025. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
